snippet: The Obama administration recommended that public schools emphasize positive behavior and use law enforcement only as a last resort.
abstract: Obama administration issues guidelines that recommend public school officials use law enforcement only as a last resort for disciplining students; guidelines are a response to a rise in zero-tolerance policies that have disproportionately increased the number or arrests, suspensions and expulsions of minority students for even minor, nonviolent offenses.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration recommended that public schools emphasize positive behavior and use law enforcement only as a last resort.

headline.main: Administration Urges Restraint in Using Arrest or Expulsion to Discipline Students
headline.print_headline: Administration Urges Restraint in Using Arrest or Expulsion to Discipline Students
